issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
h3. Steps to Reproduce
Internal failure. Unexpected usage of internal command. Please report error code: com.appcelerator.install.preflight.directory.ownership(invalid args) to Appcelerator Support with the following stack trace:Error
    at createErrorMessage (/usr/local/lib/node_modules/appcelerator/lib/error.js:117:179)
    at Object.exports.createError (/usr/local/lib/node_modules/appcelerator/lib/error.js:140:35)
    at Object.checkDirectory (/usr/local/lib/node_modules/appcelerator/lib/util.js:642:21)
    at preflight (/usr/local/lib/node_modules/appcelerator/lib/install.js:69:19)
    at start (/usr/local/lib/node_modules/appcelerator/lib/install.js:252:2)
    at Object.install (/usr/local/lib/node_modules/appcelerator/lib/install.js:299:2)
    at /usr/local/lib/node_modules/appcelerator/bin/appc:212:16
    at use (/usr/local/lib/node_modules/appcelerator/lib/use.js:98:10)
    at /usr/local/lib/node_modules/appcelerator/lib/use.js:67:12
    at IncomingMessage.<anonymous> (/usr/local/lib/node_modules/appcelerator/lib/util.js:552:5)

h3. Actual Result
failed

h3. Expected Result
update  to 4.0

comments.body:
Hello [~Sonogas],

Currently, Appcelerator Studio Version 4.1.0 so updating your studio "Help> Check for Appcelerator Updates" and then try it again using this below command.

"appc ti sdk install latest"

You may also try this following steps.
1. Logout from studio clicking on the name at the bottom right corner.
2. Logout from CLI using this command: appc logout -d
3. Open studio again
4. Login

Thanks.

Hello [~Sonogas],

Did you try those steps and is it still an issue for you? Please let us know.

Thanks
